description: c 1790, from words ending in -phobia, from Ancient Greek φόβος (phóbos, “fear”). Compare ism, from -ism, itis, from -itis, and ana, from -ana.

nouns.description: phobia (plural phobias or phobiae or phobiæ)

entries.meaning: An irrational, abnormal,  or obsessive fear (of something).
examples: I know someone with a strange phobia of ladders.
